meanings.definition: To stand out or project prominently.
meanings.sent1: The bright red flower promines in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The tall building promines against the skyline.
meanings.sent3: The colorful umbrella promines in the sea of black umbrellas.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for singing promines like a shining star in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse promines as a beacon of hope in the storm.

meanings.sent1: The tower's spire is the promines of the castle.
meanings.sent2: The promines of the mountain can be seen from afar.
meanings.sent3: The promines of the cake were the cherries on top.
meanings.sent4: His smile was the promines of his face, always lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The promines of the tree's branches reached towards the sky.
